definitions.definition: feeling angry or unhappy because somebody you like or love is showing interest in somebody else

examples.text: He's only talking to her to make you jealous.
I can remember feeling madly jealous when he was with other women.
Peter was obsessively jealous and his behaviour was driving his partner away.

definitions.definition: feeling angry or unhappy because you wish you had something that somebody else has

examples.text: Children often feel jealous when a new baby arrives.
He was rather jealous of me.
I've seen your holiday photos. I'm so jealous!
There's nothing for you to feel jealous about.

definitions.definition: wanting to keep or protect something that you have because it makes you feel proud

examples.text: They are very jealous of their good reputation *(= they do not want to lose it)*.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French gelos, from medieval Latin zelosus, from Latin zelus ‘zeal, jealousy’.
